column4: When i press the "play" button on my keyboard rythmbox starts.  how do i change the default mp3 play for the OS to be amarok?
i've already set the properties of mp3's to start with beep-media-player, so when i double click them individually they start in beep, but i want amarok to start when i press my "music player" hotkey
righclik an mp3 file select properties, one of the tabs will give you an onption to set whateverplayer as default
then you can set it to amarok and thats it :)

that's for starting individual files.  my keyboard has "hotkeys" that can start individual programs with the press of one button.  pressing my "media player" button starts rythmbox, but i want it to start amarok
i'm wondering how to tell gnome that i want my default media play to be amarok and not rythmbox
go to #kubuntu , amarok is a KDE app
actuallt there is an app for that , one second
i think it's more of a matter of telling ubuntu what the default app should be, it's not an option from within amarok
my hotkeys work.  if i press my browser hotkey firefox opens and if i press my email hotkey thunderbird opens and my volume hotkeys work
i just want ubuntu to know that amarok is my mp3 player of choice and not rythmbox
thanks.  xbindkeys worked like a charm.
